trans-unit.source: Encoding your media with Dolby Digital Plus
trans-unit.target: Encoding your media with Dolby Digital Plus

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to encode your media with Dolby Digital Plus.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to encode your media with Dolby Digital Plus.

trans-unit.source: Encoding your media with Dolby Digital Plus
trans-unit.target: Encoding your media with Dolby Digital Plus

trans-unit.source: The Azure Media Encoder supports **Dolby® Digital Plus** encoding.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Media Encoder supports **Dolby® Digital Plus** encoding.

trans-unit.source: Dolby® Digital Plus, or Enhanced AC-3 (E-AC-3), is an advanced surround sound audio codec designed specifically for evolving media.
trans-unit.target: Dolby® Digital Plus, or Enhanced AC-3 (E-AC-3), is an advanced surround sound audio codec designed specifically for evolving media.

trans-unit.source: From home theaters and PCs to mobile phones and online streaming, Dolby Digital Plus defines high-fidelity audio.
trans-unit.target: From home theaters and PCs to mobile phones and online streaming, Dolby Digital Plus defines high-fidelity audio.

trans-unit.source: You’ll get the renowned Dolby cinema experience from all your entertainment.
trans-unit.target: You’ll get the renowned Dolby cinema experience from all your entertainment.

trans-unit.source: Dolby Digital Plus is based on core Dolby Digital technologies, the established standard for cinema, broadcast, and home theater surround sound.
trans-unit.target: Dolby Digital Plus is based on core Dolby Digital technologies, the established standard for cinema, broadcast, and home theater surround sound.

trans-unit.source: As mobile devices proliferate, Dolby Digital Plus is also emerging as the standard for mobile entertainment.
trans-unit.target: As mobile devices proliferate, Dolby Digital Plus is also emerging as the standard for mobile entertainment.

trans-unit.source: Its advanced new technologies for audio enhancement deliver even better sound quality and additional bandwidth savings.
trans-unit.target: Its advanced new technologies for audio enhancement deliver even better sound quality and additional bandwidth savings.

trans-unit.source: You get great content with fewer interruptions, even when bandwidth is limited.
trans-unit.target: You get great content with fewer interruptions, even when bandwidth is limited.

trans-unit.source: Set up Azure Media Encoder to encode with Dolby Digital Plus
trans-unit.target: Set up Azure Media Encoder to encode with Dolby Digital Plus

trans-unit.source: Get Azure Media Encoder Processor
trans-unit.target: Get Azure Media Encoder Processor

trans-unit.source: Dolby Digital Plus is supported by the Azure Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: Dolby Digital Plus is supported by the Azure Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: To get a reference to the **Azure Media Encoder**, see the [Get media processors](media-services-get-media-processor.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: To get a reference to the **Azure Media Encoder**, see the [Get media processors](media-services-get-media-processor.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: Configure Azure Media Encoder settings
trans-unit.target: Configure Azure Media Encoder settings

trans-unit.source: When configuring the encoding settings for use with Azure Media Encoder, there were a number of pre-defined presets represented by easy to remember strings.
trans-unit.target: When configuring the encoding settings for use with Azure Media Encoder, there were a number of pre-defined presets represented by easy to remember strings.

trans-unit.source: The Dolby Digital Plus encoder provides a rich array of controls, see [<DolbyDigitalPlusAudioProfile>](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn296500.aspx) for more information.
trans-unit.target: The Dolby Digital Plus encoder provides a rich array of controls, see [<DolbyDigitalPlusAudioProfile>](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn296500.aspx) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Therefore there are no pre-built string presets that use this codec.
trans-unit.target: Therefore there are no pre-built string presets that use this codec.

trans-unit.source: You must specify your desired encoder settings in an XML file and submit this data with your Task as shown in the following code example:
trans-unit.target: You must specify your desired encoder settings in an XML file and submit this data with your Task as shown in the following code example:

trans-unit.source: This topic describes several example XML presets that configure the encoder settings.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes several example XML presets that configure the encoder settings.

trans-unit.source: The element used to configure Dolby Digital Plus encoding is [<DolbyDigitalPlusAudioProfile>](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn296500.aspx) which appears as a child node of the
trans-unit.target: The element used to configure Dolby Digital Plus encoding is [<DolbyDigitalPlusAudioProfile>](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn296500.aspx) which appears as a child node of the

trans-unit.source: element in an Azure Media Encoder XML preset.
trans-unit.target: element in an Azure Media Encoder XML preset.

trans-unit.source: This XML element contains a number of attributes that control various elements of the encoding.
trans-unit.target: This XML element contains a number of attributes that control various elements of the encoding.

trans-unit.source: Encoding to Dolby Digital Plus 5.1 Multichannel
trans-unit.target: Encoding to Dolby Digital Plus 5.1 Multichannel

trans-unit.source: To encode to Dolby Digital Plus 5.1 Multichannel, set Codec and EncoderMode attributes to “DolbyDigitalPlus”.
trans-unit.target: To encode to Dolby Digital Plus 5.1 Multichannel, set Codec and EncoderMode attributes to “DolbyDigitalPlus”.

trans-unit.source: The number of channels encoded is specified using the AudioCodingMode attribute of the
trans-unit.target: The number of channels encoded is specified using the AudioCodingMode attribute of the

trans-unit.source: element.
trans-unit.target: element.

trans-unit.source: For a 5.1 multichannel encoding set AudioCodingMode to “Mode32”.
trans-unit.target: For a 5.1 multichannel encoding set AudioCodingMode to “Mode32”.

trans-unit.source: The following XML preset contains a complete Azure Media Encoder XML preset that produces an MP4 file with H264 Broadband 1080p video and Dolby Digital Plus 5.1 Multichannel audio.
trans-unit.target: The following XML preset contains a complete Azure Media Encoder XML preset that produces an MP4 file with H264 Broadband 1080p video and Dolby Digital Plus 5.1 Multichannel audio.

trans-unit.source: This preset also specifies to encode a Low Frequency Effects (LFE) channel, which is specified by setting the LFEOn attribute to true.
trans-unit.target: This preset also specifies to encode a Low Frequency Effects (LFE) channel, which is specified by setting the LFEOn attribute to true.

trans-unit.source: Any attributes not specified will have their default values.
trans-unit.target: Any attributes not specified will have their default values.

trans-unit.source: This XML preset should be passed to the **Azure Media Encoder** to create an encoding job as described in [this](media-services-dotnet-encode-asset.md) topic (only instead of a predefined preset string you will pass the whole XML preset, as described [here](#configure_preset)).
trans-unit.target: This XML preset should be passed to the **Azure Media Encoder** to create an encoding job as described in [this](media-services-dotnet-encode-asset.md) topic (only instead of a predefined preset string you will pass the whole XML preset, as described [here](#configure_preset)).

trans-unit.source: Encoding to Dolby Digital Plus Stereo
trans-unit.target: Encoding to Dolby Digital Plus Stereo

trans-unit.source: To encode to Dolby Digital Plus stereo, set the Codec and EncoderMode attributes to “DolbyDigitalPlus”.
trans-unit.target: To encode to Dolby Digital Plus stereo, set the Codec and EncoderMode attributes to “DolbyDigitalPlus”.

trans-unit.source: The number of channels encoded is specified using the AudioCodingMode attribute.
trans-unit.target: The number of channels encoded is specified using the AudioCodingMode attribute.

trans-unit.source: For a stereo encoding set AudioCodingMode to “Mode20”.
trans-unit.target: For a stereo encoding set AudioCodingMode to “Mode20”.

trans-unit.source: The following XML preset example shows the
trans-unit.target: The following XML preset example shows the

trans-unit.source: used to encode to 5.1 audio.
trans-unit.target: used to encode to 5.1 audio.

trans-unit.source: Any attributes not specified will have their default values.
trans-unit.target: Any attributes not specified will have their default values.

trans-unit.source: This XML preset should be passed to the **Azure Media Encoder** to create an encoding job as described in [this](media-services-dotnet-encode-asset.md) topic (only instead of a predefined preset string you will pass the whole XML preset, as described [here](#configure_preset)).
trans-unit.target: This XML preset should be passed to the **Azure Media Encoder** to create an encoding job as described in [this](media-services-dotnet-encode-asset.md) topic (only instead of a predefined preset string you will pass the whole XML preset, as described [here](#configure_preset)).

trans-unit.source: Encoding to Multiple MP4 Files
trans-unit.target: Encoding to Multiple MP4 Files

trans-unit.source: You can encode to multiple MP4s within a single XML preset.
trans-unit.target: You can encode to multiple MP4s within a single XML preset.

trans-unit.source: For each MP4 you want to generate, add a
trans-unit.target: For each MP4 you want to generate, add a

trans-unit.source: element into the configuration.
trans-unit.target: element into the configuration.

trans-unit.source: Each
trans-unit.target: Each

trans-unit.source: element can contain configuration information for video, audio, or both.
trans-unit.target: element can contain configuration information for video, audio, or both.

trans-unit.source: Configuration
trans-unit.target: Configuration

trans-unit.source: The following configuration will generate the following outputs:
trans-unit.target: The following configuration will generate the following outputs:

trans-unit.source: 8 Video-only MP4 files
trans-unit.target: 8 Video-only MP4 files

trans-unit.source: 1080p Video @ 6000 kbps
trans-unit.target: 1080p Video @ 6000 kbps

trans-unit.source: 1080p Video @ 4700 kbps
trans-unit.target: 1080p Video @ 4700 kbps

trans-unit.source: 720p Video @ 3400 kbps
trans-unit.target: 720p Video @ 3400 kbps

trans-unit.source: 960 x 540 Video @ 2250 kbps
trans-unit.target: 960 x 540 Video @ 2250 kbps

trans-unit.source: 960 x 540 Video @ 1500 kbps
trans-unit.target: 960 x 540 Video @ 1500 kbps

trans-unit.source: 640 x 380 Video @ 1000 kbps
trans-unit.target: 640 x 380 Video @ 1000 kbps

trans-unit.source: 640 x 380 Video @ 650 kbps
trans-unit.target: 640 x 380 Video @ 650 kbps

trans-unit.source: 320 x 180 Video @ 400 kbps
trans-unit.target: 320 x 180 Video @ 400 kbps

trans-unit.source: 5 Audio-only MP4 files
trans-unit.target: 5 Audio-only MP4 files

trans-unit.source: AAC Audio Stereo @ 128 kbp
trans-unit.target: AAC Audio Stereo @ 128 kbp

trans-unit.source: AAC Audio 5.1 @ 512 kbps
trans-unit.target: AAC Audio 5.1 @ 512 kbps

trans-unit.source: Dolby Digital Plus Stereo @ 128 kbps
trans-unit.target: Dolby Digital Plus Stereo @ 128 kbps

trans-unit.source: Dolby Digital Plus 5.1 Multichannel @ 512 kbps
trans-unit.target: Dolby Digital Plus 5.1 Multichannel @ 512 kbps

trans-unit.source: AAC Stereo @ 56 kbps
trans-unit.target: AAC Stereo @ 56 kbps

trans-unit.source: A .ism manifest
trans-unit.target: A .ism manifest

trans-unit.source: An XML file listing the properties of the generated MP4 files.
trans-unit.target: An XML file listing the properties of the generated MP4 files.

trans-unit.source: Creating Commercial Encoding Services
trans-unit.target: Creating Commercial Encoding Services

trans-unit.source: Some customers may wish to build a commercial encoding service on top of Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Some customers may wish to build a commercial encoding service on top of Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating such a ‘build-on’ service it is important that all Dolby Digital Plus encoding parameters are available.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating such a ‘build-on’ service it is important that all Dolby Digital Plus encoding parameters are available.

trans-unit.source: Please ensure that all the parameters within the
trans-unit.target: Please ensure that all the parameters within the

trans-unit.source: tag are exposed and configurable by the end-user.
trans-unit.target: tag are exposed and configurable by the end-user.

trans-unit.source: Please contact prolicensingsupport@dolby.com for guidance on making these parameters available.
trans-unit.target: Please contact prolicensingsupport@dolby.com for guidance on making these parameters available.

trans-unit.source: Using Dolby Professional Loudness Metering (DPLM) Support
trans-unit.target: Using Dolby Professional Loudness Metering (DPLM) Support

trans-unit.source: The Azure Media Encoder, can use the DPLM SDK in order to measure the loudness of dialog in the input audio, and set the correct value of DialogNormalization.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Media Encoder, can use the DPLM SDK in order to measure the loudness of dialog in the input audio, and set the correct value of DialogNormalization.

trans-unit.source: This feature is enabled only if the audio is being encoded to Dolby Digital Plus.
trans-unit.target: This feature is enabled only if the audio is being encoded to Dolby Digital Plus.

trans-unit.source: DPLM is configured in a preset configuration file using the
trans-unit.target: DPLM is configured in a preset configuration file using the

trans-unit.source: element that is a child of the
trans-unit.target: element that is a child of the

trans-unit.source: element.
trans-unit.target: element.

trans-unit.source: The following sample preset shows how to configure DPLM:
trans-unit.target: The following sample preset shows how to configure DPLM:

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: element can only be specified within a
trans-unit.target: element can only be specified within a

trans-unit.source: element.
trans-unit.target: element.

trans-unit.source: If the
trans-unit.target: If the

trans-unit.source: element is used then the DialogNormalization attribute must not be used.
trans-unit.target: element is used then the DialogNormalization attribute must not be used.

trans-unit.source: The encoder generate an error if both the
trans-unit.target: The encoder generate an error if both the

trans-unit.source: element and the DialogNormalization attribute are used.
trans-unit.target: element and the DialogNormalization attribute are used.

trans-unit.source: All attributes of LoudnessMetering are optional, and the encoder will default to the values recommended by Dolby Laboratories, Inc.
trans-unit.target: All attributes of LoudnessMetering are optional, and the encoder will default to the values recommended by Dolby Laboratories, Inc.

trans-unit.source: Each attribute is described in the following sections.
trans-unit.target: Each attribute is described in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Mode Attribute
trans-unit.target: Mode Attribute

trans-unit.source: This attribute determines the loudness metering mode.
trans-unit.target: This attribute determines the loudness metering mode.

trans-unit.source: Allowed values are:
trans-unit.target: Allowed values are:

trans-unit.source: **ITU_R_BS_1770_2_DI** (default) - indicates ITU-R BS.1770-2 plus Dialogue Intelligence
trans-unit.target: **ITU_R_BS_1770_2_DI** (default) - indicates ITU-R BS.1770-2 plus Dialogue Intelligence

trans-unit.source: **ITU_R_BS_1770_1_DI** - indicates ITU-R BS.1770-1 plus Dialogue Intelligence
trans-unit.target: **ITU_R_BS_1770_1_DI** - indicates ITU-R BS.1770-1 plus Dialogue Intelligence

trans-unit.source: **ITU_R_BS_1770_2** - indicates ITU-R BS.1770-2
trans-unit.target: **ITU_R_BS_1770_2** - indicates ITU-R BS.1770-2

trans-unit.source: **LEQA_DI** - indicates Leq(A) plus Dialogue Intelligence
trans-unit.target: **LEQA_DI** - indicates Leq(A) plus Dialogue Intelligence

trans-unit.source: Note:
trans-unit.target: Note:

trans-unit.source: The** EBU R128** mode can be achieved with **ITU_R_BS_1770_2_DI**
trans-unit.target: The** EBU R128** mode can be achieved with **ITU_R_BS_1770_2_DI**

trans-unit.source: The **Leq(A)** is included purely for legacy reasons, and should only be used in specific legacy workflows
trans-unit.target: The **Leq(A)** is included purely for legacy reasons, and should only be used in specific legacy workflows

trans-unit.source: The **ITU** has recently released an update titled BS.1770-3, which is equivalent to BS.1770-2 with TruePeakDCBlock and TruePeakEmphasis both set to false
trans-unit.target: The **ITU** has recently released an update titled BS.1770-3, which is equivalent to BS.1770-2 with TruePeakDCBlock and TruePeakEmphasis both set to false

trans-unit.source: SpeechThreshold Attribute
trans-unit.target: SpeechThreshold Attribute

trans-unit.source: Specifies a speech threshold used by DPLM to produce an integrated loudness result (for example, selecting between speech gating, level gating, and no gating).
trans-unit.target: Specifies a speech threshold used by DPLM to produce an integrated loudness result (for example, selecting between speech gating, level gating, and no gating).

trans-unit.source: The speech threshold setting range is from 0% to 100%, in 1% increments.
trans-unit.target: The speech threshold setting range is from 0% to 100%, in 1% increments.

trans-unit.source: This parameter has an effect only when DPLM is configured in a mode that utilizes Dialogue Intelligence, which means it can only be specified if Mode is set to ITU_R_BS_1770_2_DI or ITU_R_BS_1770_1_DI.
trans-unit.target: This parameter has an effect only when DPLM is configured in a mode that utilizes Dialogue Intelligence, which means it can only be specified if Mode is set to ITU_R_BS_1770_2_DI or ITU_R_BS_1770_1_DI.

trans-unit.source: The default value, when Mode is either ITU_R_BS_1770_2_DI or ITU_R_BS_1770_1_DI, is 20%.
trans-unit.target: The default value, when Mode is either ITU_R_BS_1770_2_DI or ITU_R_BS_1770_1_DI, is 20%.

trans-unit.source: Values for this attribute must be set in the range 0, 1 – 100.
trans-unit.target: Values for this attribute must be set in the range 0, 1 – 100.

trans-unit.source: TruePeakDCBlock Attribute
trans-unit.target: TruePeakDCBlock Attribute

trans-unit.source: This input parameter specifies whether the DC block within the true‐peak metering is enabled (true) or disabled (false).
trans-unit.target: This input parameter specifies whether the DC block within the true‐peak metering is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

trans-unit.source: For more details of the DC block, refer to ITU‐R BS.1770‐2.The default value is false.
trans-unit.target: For more details of the DC block, refer to ITU‐R BS.1770‐2.The default value is false.

trans-unit.source: TruePeakEmphasis Attribute
trans-unit.target: TruePeakEmphasis Attribute

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the emphasis filter within the true‐peak metering is enabled (true) or disabled (false).
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the emphasis filter within the true‐peak metering is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

trans-unit.source: For more details of the emphasis filter, refer to ITU‐R BS.1770‐2.The default value is false.
trans-unit.target: For more details of the emphasis filter, refer to ITU‐R BS.1770‐2.The default value is false.

trans-unit.source: DPLM Results
trans-unit.target: DPLM Results

trans-unit.source: When an encode tasks specifies the use of DPLM, the results of the loudness measurement will be included in the metadata XML in the output Asset.
trans-unit.target: When an encode tasks specifies the use of DPLM, the results of the loudness measurement will be included in the metadata XML in the output Asset.

trans-unit.source: Following is an example.
trans-unit.target: Following is an example.

trans-unit.source: Each attribute is described below.
trans-unit.target: Each attribute is described below.

trans-unit.source: **DPLMVersionInformation** - A string representing the version of the DPLM SDK used.
trans-unit.target: **DPLMVersionInformation** - A string representing the version of the DPLM SDK used.

trans-unit.source: **DialogNormalization** - The value of DialNorm, in decibels, measured from the input audio, that will be embedded into the output DD+ stream, in the range {-31, -30, …, -1} dB.
trans-unit.target: **DialogNormalization** - The value of DialNorm, in decibels, measured from the input audio, that will be embedded into the output DD+ stream, in the range {-31, -30, …, -1} dB.

trans-unit.source: **IntegratedLoudness** - The integrated loudness as measured by DPLM, in the range -70 to +10 LKFS/dBFS (where dBFS is used only when Mode is set to LEQA_DI).
trans-unit.target: **IntegratedLoudness** - The integrated loudness as measured by DPLM, in the range -70 to +10 LKFS/dBFS (where dBFS is used only when Mode is set to LEQA_DI).

trans-unit.source: **IntegratedLoudnessGatingMethod** - Valid values are: 0 – None/Ungated; 1 – Speech Gated; 2 – Level Gated.
trans-unit.target: **IntegratedLoudnessGatingMethod** - Valid values are: 0 – None/Ungated; 1 – Speech Gated; 2 – Level Gated.

trans-unit.source: **IntegratedLoudnessSpeechPercentage** - This result contains the percentage of the input media’s timeline where speech is detected.
trans-unit.target: **IntegratedLoudnessSpeechPercentage** - This result contains the percentage of the input media’s timeline where speech is detected.

trans-unit.source: Values range from 0% to 100%.
trans-unit.target: Values range from 0% to 100%.

trans-unit.source: **SamplePeak** - This result contains the largest absolute sample value in any channel since the metering was reset, and ranges from -70 to +10 dBFS.
trans-unit.target: **SamplePeak** - This result contains the largest absolute sample value in any channel since the metering was reset, and ranges from -70 to +10 dBFS.

trans-unit.source: **TruePeak** - This result contains the largest absolute true‐peak value in any channel since the metering was reset.
trans-unit.target: **TruePeak** - This result contains the largest absolute true‐peak value in any channel since the metering was reset.

trans-unit.source: Refer to ITU‐R BS.1770‐2 for a description of true peak.
trans-unit.target: Refer to ITU‐R BS.1770‐2 for a description of true peak.

trans-unit.source: The values can range in -70 to 12.04 dBTP.
trans-unit.target: The values can range in -70 to 12.04 dBTP.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
